title: When the Experts Fail, Everyone Else Pays the Price
sub_head: What happens when the most respected authorities get it wrong and ruin lives and economies? Not much.
body:
The wealthy and powerful must constantly expand their operations. But even if they let their capital sit, they will need accountants, auditors, stockbrokers and consultants. How will they choose these subordinates? According to the opinions of other advisers. Those closest to the boss will have the most influenceâ€”and they can keep it, even in failure, by flattery and deference.
This is the case with governmental power. We are all, in a sense, fools, since no one person can know everything. We all have to trust others for...
